q: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
h:
“The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
h:
“Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.” —
Les Brown

q: To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.
h:
“To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
h:
“Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Forgive those who have hurt you.
h:
“Forgive those who have hurt you.” —
Les Brown

q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.
h:
“Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.” —
Criss Jami

q: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
h:
“Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
h:
“It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens
